avancer: help [sb] to get on more quickly
d\u00e9courager [qqn] de faire [qch]: make [sb] think [sth] is not worth the bother
d\u00e9gager: dégager les oreilles : cut it short around the ears
se devoir [qch]: have a duty to + [vtr/vi + prep] each other/one another
diff\u00e9rer sur: be at variance with each other on
s'\u00e9loigner: get some distance between you and [sth]
estimer: have a great deal of respect for
s'\u00e9viter: stay out of each other's way
h\u00e9siter \u00e0 faire [qch]: not be sure whether to do [sth]
se louer de faire [qch]: be pleased with yourself for doing [sth]
mesurer: be X by X by X (in dimension/in size)
payer: be money to be made in [sth]
se p\u00e9n\u00e9trer de [qch]: allow yourself to be filled with [sth]
pr\u00e9f\u00e9rer [qch] \u00e0 autre ch: have a preference for [sth] over [sth] else
reconna\u00eetre: get the lay of the land
